Mourning the loss of Kofi Annan, the first black African Secretary General of the UN, a Nobel Prize laureate & a powerful advocate for peace, human rights & dignity for all people. His contributions to Africa & the world will be remembered for generations. https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-45232892

98 years ago, the 19th Amendment was ratified, prohibiting any citizen from being denied the right to vote because of their gender. But the struggle for women’s suffrage did not end there. Women of color and poor women continued to face barriers — and many still do to this day.

An @NPR report last year found that teachers typically spend at least $500 of their own money on school supplies. It’s ridiculous. We should be providing teachers with fair pay and the resources to do their jobs.
https://twitter.com/NPR/status/1030462925054599168 QT @NPR 📷 The Teacher Supply Swap, a free store for educators in Baltimore, is serving a community with a child poverty rate higher than the national average. https://www.npr.org/2018/08/17/636832519/teachers-turning-to-free-supply-shops-to-outfit-their-classrooms?utm_source=twitter.com&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=npr&utm_term=nprnews&utm_content=20180817 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DkzwSrcX4AACHIP.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DkzwVGuX4AAwDuG.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DkzwYg-W0AA7plZ.jpg

The bomb that killed 40 children on a school bus in Yemen last week was sold to the Saudis by the US. This Administration must answer for our continued support of the Saudi-led campaign. https://twitter.com/senwarren/status/1029492416829632517 QT @SenWarren The US has been assisting Saudi Arabia's military strikes in Yemen for 3 years. Thousands of civilians have died. The American people deserve to know the full scope of our operations in Yemen so we can hold our partners – and ourselves – accountable. https://theintercept.com/2018/08/14/elizabeth-warren-yemen-bombing-us-military/
